snippet: Western diplomats and analysts say Burundi could explode in violence when a deadline for opposition groups to disarm expires Saturday.
abstract: Coming deadline for opposition groups in Burundi to disarm has raised concerns among Western analysts and diplomats that country could erupt in violence; deadline was set by Pres Pierre Nkurunziza, who won contentious election for third term and has called on opposition to disarm or be labeled as terrorists.
lead_paragraph: Western diplomats and analysts say Burundi could explode in violence when a deadline for opposition groups to disarm expires Saturday.

headline.main: West Fears Burundi Is on Brink of Conflict
headline.print_headline: West Fears Conflict May Erupt in Burundi as Opposition Faces Deadline to Disarm
